channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Domestic fly tipping, 29th November
item.description:
This rubbish has been here and growing for at least a month. It is now becoming a health risk.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Waterfield Close, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous road surfaces on Goswell Road., 29th November
item.description:
For over three years the road surfaces on the Goswell Road between Fann Street and Old Street have become dangerous especially for motorcyclists and cyclists. The City of London, Islington Council and TFL deny responsibility and ownership and have not repaired the surfaces. It is simply shameful and dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 108, Goswell Road, Finsbury, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox by Green data box, 29th November
item.description:
Dead fox by Green data box on public pavement A lot of families park on wickham street to visit the farm/stables and this would be very upsetting to a small child
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wickham Street, East Wickham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The whole of Inverine Road needs sweeping/leaf clearance, 29th November
item.description:
There is no separate category for this problem on Fix My Street so here goes. I have just visited an elderly friend in Inverine Road who is too afraid to go out shopping because of the state of the street. There are shin deep piles of slippery leaves on the pavement, in the kerbs and on the road. Also there are tree roots from street trees breaking through the pavements making it even more dangerous for pedestrians. There has been no attention to this street for WEEKS so if Greenwich really does want residents to keep safe this winter (and avoid the NHS) PLEASE GET THIS STREET SWEPT and LEAVES REMOVED. AUDIT AND REMOVE DANGEROUS TREES.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Inverine Road, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Recurring litter problem from 13-15 Gunton Rd, 29th November
item.description:
Please advise the residents how to deal with their rubbish. The bins are overflowing several times a week and dirty nappies are regularly lay strewn on the pavement. I’ve seen more rats along this stretch in the past 3 months than in the last 8 years.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gunton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly Tipping Commercial Waste, 29th November
item.description:
The Three Hounds continue to leave their commercial waste on the public pavement outside of the collection window. This has previously been reported several times and continues to happen on a regular basis which is contrary to the commercial waste regulations in Bromley which states the business owner can be spoken with and fined. No enforcement or action seems to have been taken as this continues regularly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 61, Beckenham Road, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continuous dangerous parking, 29th November
item.description:
This man is continuously parking dangerously, he’s parking his large van or large private cars on the pavement on a bend making people have to walk in the road , theres a school in this road & I’ve seen children walking in the road around his van or car as he’s blocked the pavement .. it’s very dangerous

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Highlands Hill, Christchurch, Sevenoaks
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Just noticed the problems in the last two weeks. Opposite the Gordon School , in front of 107 Craigton Road. It needs looking at as someone will end up Injuring themselves and it’s a busy school road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Craigton Road, Eltham

item.title: Newmarsh Road/Grasshaven Way Flytipping, 29th November
item.description:
Another flytipping hot spot that requires attention, the council have been made aware of the flytipping in this estate - it's getting worse and worse each year, we need camera installed and the area cleared

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Newmarsh Road, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grsshaven way/Newmarsh Road, 29th November
item.description:
This and the area in the middle of the green on newmarsh Road, is constantly being used for flytipping, each week, it's getting worse and worse, please clear and put some measures in place to hold these offenders accountable, they live on the road, so can't be hard to do. We just want an end to this!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Newmarsh Road, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping on public walkway on Newmarsh Road, 29th November
item.description:
I raised a complaint about this on-going fly-tipping issue 2 weeks ago on fix my street and it's now mysterious not here anymore? Residents have been raising a compliant about this stop all through this year and the council keeps suffenly blamng Peabody and leaving the rubbish to rotten and attrack rats. Please get this cleaned up as soon as possible and put up cameras to prevent the continous flytipping its been going on for years now and is just getting worse and worse.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Newmarsh Road, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous falling hazard. Big hole on a very busy path, 29th November
item.description:
There is a very deep hole and seems very dangerous. The path is very busy with runners and walkers all day. Please could you take a look for us as this is a big safety risk. Thank you!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 366-376, Rotherhithe Street, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
